If you've ever watched Caillou over & over, you're familiar with all the episodes...so pretty much these are all repeats, some with the earlier "whiny" Caillou & some with the later "matured" Caillou. However, there are NO puppets, which is what I was looking for..yay! There's opening credits from the earlier show with them but they DO NOT make an appearance AT ALL. There are ads for other DVDs at the start of the DVD but what DVD doesn't have that. The only way to bypass them is fast forward. Before the episodes starts, of course they include the PBS Kids sponsor acknowledgement for Chuck E Cheese like they do on the station. Unfortunately you can't skip it; no biggie, it doesn't last long or you can fast forward. I'm happy with this purchase & happy my 2 year old will be happy with her favorite show.

Until now, I've never had a single complaint about my near-perfect three year old. From sleeping through the night at 6 weeks of, giving up bottles and his crib and moving to his own room - even taking baths and going to bed every night without a single complaint and potty training and reading on his own at 2.

UNTIL CAILLOU.  And I'm not joking. This isn't a joke review. This is a serious complaint.

That obnoxious little brat, Caillou, in just two episodes, has my son WHINING "I can't!!" to EVERYTHING he is asked to do. "Time to get out of the tub, sweetie," I tell him. "I caaaaaaannnn't." He whines in this horrible squeal. I had NO IDEA where this abhorrent behavior came from until I caught THREE SECONDS of this horrible show on tv.

My won was watching intently and I said "turn the tv off please." And to my horror, he dropped to the floor, and started whining over and over "I can't!  I can't".

I wanted to throw up.  No shock- this horrible excuse for a television show has been PERMANENTLY banned from our home. I will tell every parent I know of this god -awful excuse for an "educational program".

My son has caught glimpses of sponge bob (crude), power rangers (physical fighting) and even half an hour of gremlins (not in my presence, but I found out he saw the most gruesome parts) and had ZERO reaction to these things - he didn't karate chop our house cats, or imitate any of the crude humor on sponge bob....but in a mere TWO MINUTES of "CAILLOU" my son immediately picked up that petulant little Bart's HORRIBLE incessant whine and his "I can't" crap that he spews every time he is asked or told to do ANYTHING.

BY FAR the worst children's show I've ever seen.  PBS should be paying for a professional to help me fix this behavior (and a trip to the spa to relax my nerves after listening to the whining I'd never had to deal with before "CAILLOU". Flat out AWFUL.

Kayt
(Mom to one son, 3)
This Caillou movie collection is great for the grandkids.  They can watch it on the DVD player or on the computer.  It is the "Caillou classics".  Good value.

Purchased Caillou's Family Favorites (Full Frame), Caillou's Fun Outside, and Caillou: Big Brother Caillou & Other Adventures from Walmart. BIG MISTAKE!! There are "puppet shows" after every single episode of Caillou. The product description on the Walmart site did not mention that. It makes it seem like the DVD's are straight Caillou for 80 minutes or 100 minutes, whatever. THEY'RE NOT! My 2 year old has no desire to view anything other than Caillou. You have to find the remote after each episode and be prepared to go to the play list and select the next Caillou episode, as the dumb puppet shows come on after EVERY episode of Caillou. Frustrating!!!!!! DO NOT BUY ANY OF THE ABOVE WITHOUT ASKING about the puppet shows being on a particular DVD. The distributors should feel an obligation to state that fact in the product description.

This is a great DVD of a great program.
Ironically you will find many people whining that Caillou is whiny. Apparently some think he is whiney in old episodes only and some say it is newer episodes. Some say he is whiney in Sprout episodes and some say PBS episodes. I wasn't aware that the channels played different episodes. Some will only let their kids watch "non whiney" episodes as if their leaving the work of modeling good behavior to television. If Caillou is acting up in an episode, you could use the opportunity to point out how his behavior is poor and what the consequences are if your own kids were to behave like that.
In some circumatances Caillou is whiney and some he is not, but that is parallel to at least most parents reality.
What's great about Caillou is that he is learning and experiencing things just like all young children. My children find him fascinating and I appreciate the simplicity and gentleness of the program. His parents model patience which most parents, like myself, could use more.
The best part about this particular DVD is there are no puppets, my girls do not like them at all. I consider this program safe to "babysit" my girls for a few minutes :)
My three year old son simply loves this DVD.  The fact that he loves it makes it a great product, in my eyes.
My three year old son just loves to watch this episodes over and over again, and I am happy because he is learning from them.
The dvds are ntsc!!! we ordered from australia expecting the dvds to be suitable for our region, there was no mention of them being ntsc on the product information page!!

There are no silly puppets on this DVD. I highly recommend this DVD as well as Caillou's Playschool Adventures and Caillou, The Everyday Hero.

They are really professional and I shop amazon.com comfortably.

My son absolutely loves watching Caillou on the sprout network so we thought this was a good idea for traveling.  He loves the dvd, and I was pleasantly surprised by the musical skits in between each episode (which are not shown on sprout).
The dvd contains mostly newer episdoes, but there are a few older ones on the dvd that my son is not familiar with.  The voices are different and the animation and look of caillou is also different.  He's very aware of it and usually wanders off during those episodes.
Overall, a good DVD.

I first saw this cartoon on tv while while flipping through the channels.  I was interested, checked out the reviews on Amazon and bought it to try it out.  My daughters love it.  We have many DVDS, barney, winnie-the-poo, etc and Caillou is their favorite.  It shows life from the perspective of a 5 year old, the characters have real world personalities (no dancing dinosaurs).  The story lines follows an extended family and the situations are positive and educational.  Now my daughters mention the characters in conversations.  For example, "Say thank you, like Caillou does."  Caillou can be whiny once in a while (as noted in the low score reviews) but what child his age isn't at times?  I think his family demonstrate well how to young children in a bad mood, with light hearted humor and thoughtful distractions. Caillou is a positive role model for my children and families.

This is 100% animated Caillou episodes. No more of those stupid puppet segments! Toddlers can pick up from life lessons based on how Caillou deals with everyday life. Family, friends & teacher guides Caillou on how to be a better person!
This was a great DVD.  It does not have the breaks w/ the puppets between each Caillou cartoon so this is a plus.  Lasts for over an hour for long trips on the road.
My daughter can't get enough of Caillou, this DVD has saved my sanity by giving us more than the 6 or so episodes that seem to constantly be repeated on TV.

Caillou is like every young boy and his family like so many. Ours has two moms, but the world is made up of all sorts of families- Calliou and his family are just one of them. The messages of kindness, sharing, dealing with frustration and loving each other no matter what are universal.
This was a gift for a 2 1/2 year old.  It continues to be  big hit,Sophie loves calliou.
My godson really enjoys Caillou and the prompt delivery was a great lifesaver with these Caillou products.

My 3 boys (one 3 Y-O and two 21 month-old) are already familiar with Calliou through the Sprout/PBS Channels and they love it.  My husband and I purchased this DVD in anticipation of them having earlier bedtimes and not being able to see Calliou in the evenings.  It's a few of the old favorite episodes with some new ones thrown in, and we appreciate the values highlighted in each epsiode.  We use Calliou's situations with family and friends as discussion points for appropriate and inappropriate behaviors and actions.  The shows are well-written and light-hearted, but realistic.

The only thing that I wish the DVD had was rolling credits after each episode, but for selfish reasons - the credits are how my children know the episode is over! :-)

PBS has really scored with this series and I would definitely recommend this to parents of toddlers/preschoolers.

Great movie. Perfect length to keep the interest of my 3 yr.old. This movie was just another one added to our already great collection of Caillou movies. I definately reccommend this for toddler thru pre-k. Although, my older son will also sit and watch this too, at times.

I was expecting some more content in the video.

Nevertheless, my 2 year old loves it and I am glad he is learning from it.
My son got this the other day and I think has already watched it like 17 times! He just loves it and I love that its about family and has good meanings and lessons.

There are NO puppets in this dvd. :-) ...(In earlier dvds with Caillou, they had annoying puppets interrupting the episodes).  This one (and multiple others are Puppet FREE.... just straight Caillou episodes).
Here is a list of the dvd's I've bought that are ALL puppet free.
Caillou: Winter Wonders
Caillou: Caillou's Family Favorites
Caillou: Caillou's Playschool Adventures
Caillou: Caillou the Creative
Caillou's Holiday Movie
My 2-year old daughter LOVES Caillou.  It's nice to have the dvd's that are straight cartoon episodes with no iterruptions.  I think Winter Wonders & Family Favorites have really cute episodes. Caillou dancing with his Grandma was really cute. But these are ALL just darling and all keep my 2-year old interested.

My granddaughters love Caillou. We have watched and rewatched this DVD several times a week for the last month or so. They laugh and learn with Caillou and his little sister Rosie. The DVD's generate a lot of discussion about Caillou and his life!
My 2 year-old daughter loves this DVD- I'm not exactly sure why, but we love the fact that "Caillou" demonstrates traditional family values!!
This includes some of the best episodes from the television show.  It contains short entertaining shows for toddler viewing.

This is a wonderful, wholesome DVD.  I love the fact that the family is complete (both Mom AND Dad), and they even have the grandparents too.  This video has the traditional values that's so missing in some videos recently.  I found nothing objectionable in this video and there were no scary scenes at all---something I'm happy about.  Nothing horribly dramatic for them to have to "work through."  Just common fun everyday things.  So far this is definitely one of our very favorite Caillou DVD's.  I even enjoy watching it!

I PURCHASED THIS CAILLOU DVD FOR MY 3-YR OLD GRANDSON.  HE REALLY ENJOYS WATCHING ALL THE EPISODES. THE BASEBALL GAME IS HIS FAVORITE EPISODE AND HE DANCES ALONG WITH CAILLOU WHEN HIS GRANDMA IS SHOWING HIM HOW SHE USE TO DANCE. EXCELLENT!  I GIVE IT 4 STARS.

L.INCHAURREGUI
LINCOLN,CA

I pre-ordered this item and looked forward to new Caillou cartoons.  On the back of our previous Caillou videos, they all describe the product as a "compilation of 4 new Caillou episodes."  However, this new version describes its contents as "4 Caillou episodes."  That is because they recycle material from previous videos.  There is some new content, but they shouldn't recycle any old material.  I do not recommend purchasing this video.

Until now, I've never had a single complaint about my near-perfect three year old. From sleeping through the night at 6 weeks of, giving up bottles and his crib and moving to his own room - even taking baths and going to bed every night without a single complaint and potty training and reading on his own at 2.

UNTIL CAILLOU.  And I'm not joking. This isn't a joke review. This is a serious complaint.

That obnoxious little brat, Caillou, in just two episodes, has my son WHINING "I can't!!" to EVERYTHING he is asked to do. "Time to get out of the tub, sweetie," I tell him. "I caaaaaaannnn't." He whines in this horrible squeal. I had NO IDEA where this abhorrent behavior came from until I caught THREE SECONDS of this horrible show on tv.

My won was watching intently and I said "turn the tv off please." And to my horror, he dropped to the floor, and started whining over and over "I can't!  I can't".

I wanted to throw up.  No shock- this horrible excuse for a television show has been PERMANENTLY banned from our home. I will tell every parent I know of this god -awful excuse for an "educational program".

My son has caught glimpses of sponge bob (crude), power rangers (physical fighting) and even half an hour of gremlins (not in my presence, but I found out he saw the most gruesome parts) and had ZERO reaction to these things - he didn't karate chop our house cats, or imitate any of the crude humor on sponge bob....but in a mere TWO MINUTES of "CAILLOU" my son immediately picked up that petulant little Bart's HORRIBLE incessant whine and his "I can't" crap that he spews every time he is asked or told to do ANYTHING.

BY FAR the worst children's show I've ever seen.  PBS should be paying for a professional to help me fix this behavior (and a trip to the spa to relax my nerves after listening to the whining I'd never had to deal with before "CAILLOU". Flat out AWFUL.

Kayt
(Mom to one son, 3)
This Caillou movie collection is great for the grandkids.  They can watch it on the DVD player or on the computer.  It is the "Caillou classics".  Good value.

Purchased Caillou's Family Favorites (Full Frame), Caillou's Fun Outside, and Caillou: Big Brother Caillou & Other Adventures from Walmart. BIG MISTAKE!! There are "puppet shows" after every single episode of Caillou. The product description on the Walmart site did not mention that. It makes it seem like the DVD's are straight Caillou for 80 minutes or 100 minutes, whatever. THEY'RE NOT! My 2 year old has no desire to view anything other than Caillou. You have to find the remote after each episode and be prepared to go to the play list and select the next Caillou episode, as the dumb puppet shows come on after EVERY episode of Caillou. Frustrating!!!!!! DO NOT BUY ANY OF THE ABOVE WITHOUT ASKING about the puppet shows being on a particular DVD. The distributors should feel an obligation to state that fact in the product description.

This is a great DVD of a great program.
Ironically you will find many people whining that Caillou is whiny. Apparently some think he is whiney in old episodes only and some say it is newer episodes. Some say he is whiney in Sprout episodes and some say PBS episodes. I wasn't aware that the channels played different episodes. Some will only let their kids watch "non whiney" episodes as if their leaving the work of modeling good behavior to television. If Caillou is acting up in an episode, you could use the opportunity to point out how his behavior is poor and what the consequences are if your own kids were to behave like that.
In some circumatances Caillou is whiney and some he is not, but that is parallel to at least most parents reality.
What's great about Caillou is that he is learning and experiencing things just like all young children. My children find him fascinating and I appreciate the simplicity and gentleness of the program. His parents model patience which most parents, like myself, could use more.
The best part about this particular DVD is there are no puppets, my girls do not like them at all. I consider this program safe to "babysit" my girls for a few minutes :)
My three year old son simply loves this DVD.  The fact that he loves it makes it a great product, in my eyes.

My son absolutely loves watching Caillou on the sprout network so we thought this was a good idea for traveling.  He loves the dvd, and I was pleasantly surprised by the musical skits in between each episode (which are not shown on sprout).
The dvd contains mostly newer episdoes, but there are a few older ones on the dvd that my son is not familiar with.  The voices are different and the animation and look of caillou is also different.  He's very aware of it and usually wanders off during those episodes.
Overall, a good DVD.

I first saw this cartoon on tv while while flipping through the channels.  I was interested, checked out the reviews on Amazon and bought it to try it out.  My daughters love it.  We have many DVDS, barney, winnie-the-poo, etc and Caillou is their favorite.  It shows life from the perspective of a 5 year old, the characters have real world personalities (no dancing dinosaurs).  The story lines follows an extended family and the situations are positive and educational.  Now my daughters mention the characters in conversations.  For example, "Say thank you, like Caillou does."  Caillou can be whiny once in a while (as noted in the low score reviews) but what child his age isn't at times?  I think his family demonstrate well how to young children in a bad mood, with light hearted humor and thoughtful distractions. Caillou is a positive role model for my children and families.

This is 100% animated Caillou episodes. No more of those stupid puppet segments! Toddlers can pick up from life lessons based on how Caillou deals with everyday life. Family, friends & teacher guides Caillou on how to be a better person!
This was a great DVD.  It does not have the breaks w/ the puppets between each Caillou cartoon so this is a plus.  Lasts for over an hour for long trips on the road.
My daughter can't get enough of Caillou, this DVD has saved my sanity by giving us more than the 6 or so episodes that seem to constantly be repeated on TV.

Caillou is like every young boy and his family like so many. Ours has two moms, but the world is made up of all sorts of families- Calliou and his family are just one of them. The messages of kindness, sharing, dealing with frustration and loving each other no matter what are universal.
This was a gift for a 2 1/2 year old.  It continues to be  big hit,Sophie loves calliou.
My godson really enjoys Caillou and the prompt delivery was a great lifesaver with these Caillou products.

My 3 boys (one 3 Y-O and two 21 month-old) are already familiar with Calliou through the Sprout/PBS Channels and they love it.  My husband and I purchased this DVD in anticipation of them having earlier bedtimes and not being able to see Calliou in the evenings.  It's a few of the old favorite episodes with some new ones thrown in, and we appreciate the values highlighted in each epsiode.  We use Calliou's situations with family and friends as discussion points for appropriate and inappropriate behaviors and actions.  The shows are well-written and light-hearted, but realistic.

The only thing that I wish the DVD had was rolling credits after each episode, but for selfish reasons - the credits are how my children know the episode is over! :-)

PBS has really scored with this series and I would definitely recommend this to parents of toddlers/preschoolers.

Great movie. Perfect length to keep the interest of my 3 yr.old. This movie was just another one added to our already great collection of Caillou movies. I definately reccommend this for toddler thru pre-k. Although, my older son will also sit and watch this too, at times.

There are NO puppets in this dvd. :-) ...(In earlier dvds with Caillou, they had annoying puppets interrupting the episodes).  This one (and multiple others are Puppet FREE.... just straight Caillou episodes).

Caillou dancing with his Grandma was really cute. But these are ALL just darling and all keep my 2-year old interested.

This includes some of the best episodes from the television show.  It contains short entertaining shows for toddler viewing.

This is a wonderful, wholesome DVD.  I love the fact that the family is complete (both Mom AND Dad), and they even have the grandparents too.  This video has the traditional values that's so missing in some videos recently.  I found nothing objectionable in this video and there were no scary scenes at all---something I'm happy about.  Nothing horribly dramatic for them to have to "work through."  Just common fun everyday things.  So far this is definitely one of our very favorite Caillou DVD's.  I even enjoy watching it!
